intro: Linosyris brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Linosyris brasiliensis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes.
